query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Noi andavam con li diece demoni. 14 Ahi fiera compagnia! ma ne la chiesa 15 coi santi, e in taverna coi ghiottoni.
query.result:
**English:**
13 We went with the ten demons. 14 Ah, fierce company! but in church 15 with the saints, and in the tavern with the gluttons.
**Cornish:**
13 Ni a vea gans an deg demon. 14 Ah, fella company! mes y'n eglos 15 gans an sens, ha y'n taverna gans an ghiottoni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Pur a la pegola era la mia ’ntesa, 17 per veder de la bolgia ogne contegno 18 e de la gente ch’entro v’era incesa.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Yet my attention was on the pitch, 17 to see every detail of the ditch 18 and of the people who were burning inside it.
**Cornish:**
16 Mes orth y'n pegola vea va'm ens, 17 rag gweles a'n bolgia pub contegno 18 ha'n dus a dus o vea ensys incesa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Come i dalfini, quando fanno segno 20 a’ marinar con l’arco de la schiena 21 che s’argomentin di campar lor legno,
22 talor così, ad alleggiar la pena, 23 mostrav’ alcun de’ peccatori ’l dosso 24 e nascondea in men che non balena.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Like dolphins, when they signal 20 to sailors with the arch of their backs 21 that they should prepare to save their ship,
22 sometimes, to ease their pain, 23 one of the sinners would show his back 24 and hide it again in less time than it takes a lightning bolt.
**Cornish:**
19 Dell yw’n dalfini, pub tra y fons synn 20 dhe’n marinar gans ark a’n scovan 21 aga argomenta dhe campar aga les,
22 pub tra vella, rag alleviaga’n poen, 23 a wra’th mostevi nebes a’n peccatori ’n dos 24 ha cuski y’n le a-ves na balena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 E come a l’orlo de l’acqua d’un fosso 26 stanno i ranocchi pur col muso fuori, 27 sì che celano i piedi e l’altro grosso,
28 sì stavan d’ogne parte i peccatori; 29 ma come s’appressava Barbariccia, 30 così si ritraén sotto i bollori.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And like frogs around the edge of a ditch, 26 they kept their snouts out of the water, 27 so that they hid their feet and the rest of their bodies,
28 so the sinners stood on every side; 29 but when Barbariccia approached, 30 they drew back beneath the boiling pitch.
**Cornish:**
25 Ha dell yw ranocchi orth y’n glann dowr a fos 26 y fons pub tra gans myns orth, 27 vel y cel an treys ha’n aral gros,
28 vella vea fons pub tu a’n peccatori; 29 mes dell s’appress vea Barbariccia, 30 vella y fons retreath orth y’n boillori.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 I’ sapea già di tutti quanti ’l nome, 38 sì li notai quando fuorono eletti, 39 e poi ch’e’ si chiamaro, attesi come.
query.result:
**English:**
37 I already knew the names of all of them, 38 for I had noted them down when they were chosen, 39 and then, when they called to each other, I listened carefully.
**Cornish:**
37 Me a sovia orth pub tra aga hanow, 38 vel y notis pub tra vea fons eletti, 39 ha wosa vea y fons galow, attestis dell.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «O Rubicante, fa che tu li metti 41 li unghioni a dosso, sì che tu lo scuoi!», 42 gridavan tutti insieme i maladetti.
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O Rubicante, make sure you dig 41 your claws into his back, so that you flay him!", 42 all the damned shouted together.
**Cornish:**
40 "O Rubicante, fa aga thu li metti 41 li unghioni a dos, vel thu li scuoi!", 42 gridavan pub tra yn aga maladetti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E io: «Maestro mio, fa, se tu puoi, 44 che tu sappi chi è lo sciagurato 45 venuto a man de li avversari suoi».
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I: "Master, do, if you are able, 44 so that you may know who is the unfortunate one 45 come into the hands of his adversaries."
**Cornish:**
43 Ha my: "Mestr agam, gra, marow ty a yl, 44 marow ty pyw yw an drwgfortyn 45 deuth dhe'n dhewlyn a'y enebyon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Lo duca mio li s’accostò allato; 47 domandollo ond’ ei fosse, e quei rispuose: 48 «I’ fui del regno di Navarra nato.
query.result:
**English:**
46 My leader approached him at his side; 47 he asked him where he was from, and he replied: 48 "I was born in the kingdom of Navarre.
**Cornish:**
46 An dyghowrth agam a dheuth dhe'y hyns; 47 ev a vynnasas orth py le mayth ev, hagena ev: 48 "Y'm genys a'n Ruvaneth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Mia madre a servo d’un segnor mi puose, 50 che m’avea generato d’un ribaldo, 51 distruggitor di sé e di sue cose.
query.result:
**English:**
49 My mother placed me in service to a lord, 50 who had begotten me from a scoundrel, 51 a destroyer of himself and his possessions.
**Cornish:**
49 Va mam a'm gorraas dhe servas dhe unn argluth, 50 a'm genas orth dhyworth unn drwg, 51 dinythyas orth ha'y studh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Poi fui famiglia del buon re Tebaldo; 53 quivi mi misi a far baratteria, 54 di ch’io rendo ragione in questo caldo».
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then I became a member of the household of the good King Thibault; 53 there I set myself to swindling, 54 for which I am paying the penalty in this heat."
**Cornish:**
52 Wosa henna servas dhe'n da Vas Tebald; 53 eno y'm gorraas dhe obera bargen, 54 rag orth y'm gorra orth pennans y'n tommder ma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 E Cirïatto, a cui di bocca uscia 56 d’ogne parte una sanna come a porco, 57 li fé sentir come l’una sdruscia.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And Ciriaco, from whose mouth issued 56 on every side a tusk like a boar's, 57 made him feel how one of them rips.
**Cornish:**
55 Ha Kiryak, orth a'y genow a dheuth 56 pub traow unn davas avel orth unn hwug, 57 a wrug ev mos pub traow unn a'y dhreus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Tra male gatte era venuto ’l sorco; 59 ma Barbariccia il chiuse con le braccia 60 e disse: «State in là, mentr’ io lo ’nforco».
query.result:
**English:**
58 The mouse had come among evil cats; 59 but Barbariccia seized him with his arms 60 and said: "Stand back while I truss him up."
**Cornish:**
58 Y'n mysk an kas ha'n deuth an logoden; 59 mes Barbariccia a'y kemeras gans y'n bregh 60 ha leverel: "Sevwgh ena, bys vy'm gorra orth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 E al maestro mio volse la faccia; 62 «Domanda», disse, «ancor, se più disii 63 saper da lui, prima ch’altri ’l disfaccia».
query.result:
**English:**
61 And he turned his face to my master; 62 "Ask him," he said, "again, if you desire 63 to know more from him, before someone else tears him apart."
**Cornish:**
61 Ha'y troas y'n fas dhe'n mestr agam; 62 "Govy," leverel, "arall, marow ty a vynnas 63 moy dhe'y, kyns esel aral a'y dhreus."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Lo duca dunque: «Or dì: de li altri rii 65 conosci tu alcun che sia latino 66 sotto la pece?». E quelli: «I’ mi partii,
67 poco è, da un che fu di là vicino.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Then the leader said: "Now tell me: of the other evil ones, 65 do you know any who are Latin, 66 under the pitch?" And he said: "I recently left 67 one who was from near there.
**Cornish:**
64 An dyghowrth ena: "Lever mes: a'n erel erel 65 esow ty neb an Latin 66 y'n-dann an pek?" Ha'gena ev: "Y'm partias,
67 bys vyth, dhyworth unn o bysi ena."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
68 Così foss’ io ancor con lui coperto, 69 ch’i’ non temerei unghia né uncino!».
70 E Libicocco «Troppo avem sofferto», 71 disse; e preseli ’l braccio col runciglio, 72 sì che, stracciando, ne portò un lacerto.
query.result:
**English:**
68 If only I were still covered with him, 69 for I would not fear claw or hook!"
70 And Libicocco said, "We have suffered too much," 71 and seized his arm with his grappling-hook, 72 so that, tearing it, he carried off a piece of it.
**Cornish:**
68 Marow vyth ow kovrys gans ev, 69 rag na vyth ow ovna dowr nag unow!"
70 Ha Libikoko leverel: "Nyns yw gorrys gansyn," 71 ha kemeras y'n bregh gans y'n runkil, 72 bys, ow dreus, ev a gavas unn tamm orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Draghignazzo anco i volle dar di piglio 74 giuso a le gambe; onde ’l decurio loro 75 si volse intorno intorno con mal piglio.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Draghignazzo also wanted to seize him 74 down by the legs; whereupon their overseer 75 turned around and around with an evil look.
**Cornish:**
73 Draghignazzo a vynnasas orth kemeras ev 74 wartha dhe'y eskern; rag an dekyuryon orth 75 a droas wartha ha wartha gans unn golwg drwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Quand’ elli un poco rappaciati fuoro, 77 a lui, ch’ancor mirava sua ferita, 78 domandò ’l duca mio sanza dimoro:
79 «Chi fu colui da cui mala partita 80 di’ che facesti per venire a proda?».
query.result:
**English:**
76 When they were somewhat reconciled, 77 my lord asked him, who was still looking at his wound, 78 without delay:
79 "Who was the one from whom you made a bad departure, 80 tell me, in order to come to shore?".
**Cornish:**
76 Pyw hedho onan byghan raghas, 77 dhe dhodho, hag o hwra veur dhe won, 78 an dus an dywgh dhemmyn heb omdhre:
79 "Pyw o an onan a wrug dha omdhregh drog, 80 leverel, rag dhe dheuth dhe'n fordh?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
81 Ed ei rispuose: «Fu frate Gomita,
82 quel di Gallura, vasel d’ogne froda, 83 ch’ebbe i nemici di suo donno in mano, 84 e fé sì lor, che ciascun se ne loda.
query.result:
**English:**
81 And he answered him: "It was friar Gomita,
82 he of Gallura, a vessel of every fraud, 83 who had his lord's enemies in his power, 84 and did such things to them that everyone praises him.
**Cornish:**
81 Ha dhodho dhodho: "O Fri Gomita,
82 an onan a Galura, lester a bub froth, 83 hag a gavas enebow dhe'y argluydh y'n pow, 84 ha wrug dhedha dhe'n fordh pubonan a'y mol."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Danar si tolse e lasciolli di piano, 86 sì com’ e’ dice; e ne li altri offici anche 87 barattier fu non picciol, ma sovrano.
query.result:
**English:**
85 He took money and left them in peace, 86 just as he says; and in his other offices too 87 he was a barterer, not a small one, but a master.
**Cornish:**
85 Ev a gemeras arghans ha'y gavas y'n peth, 86 kepar ha leverel; ha y'n y offisow erel 87 o baratter o na veu byghan, mes ughella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Usa con esso donno Michel Zanche 89 di Logodoro; e a dir di Sardigna 90 le lingue lor non si sentono stanche.
query.result:
**English:**
88 He was in cahoots with lord Michel Zanche 89 of Logodoro; and to tell of Sardinia 90 their tongues do not tire.
**Cornish:**
88 Ev a usya gans an Arluydh Michel Zanche 89 a Logudoro; ha rag leverel a-dro dhe Sardigna 90 nyns yw aga tavosow marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Omè, vedete l’altro che digrigna; 92 i’ direi anche, ma i’ temo ch’ello 93 non s’apparecchi a grattarmi la tigna».
query.result:
**English:**
91 Oh me, look at the other one who is gnashing his teeth; 92 I would tell you too, but I fear that he 93 is preparing to scratch my scurf».
**Cornish:**
91 Omé, gwel an aral a wra dha dhens, 92 vy a leverel dhe, mes y’m boes dhe vo 93 na wra parat dhe skraffa vy gwallen».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 E ’l gran proposto, vòlto a Farfarello 95 che stralunava li occhi per fedire, 96 disse: «Fatti ’n costà, malvagio uccello!».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the great provost, turning to Farfarello 95 who was rolling his eyes to strike, 96 said: «Get over there, wicked bird!».
**Cornish:**
94 Ha'n briost meur, troys dhe Farfarello 95 hag o stralunya y dhens rag dhe'n daro, 96 a leverel: «Gwra dhe'n fordh, edhen vyll!».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 «Se voi volete vedere o udire», 98 ricominciò lo spaürato appresso, 99 «Toschi o Lombardi, io ne farò venire;
100 ma stieno i Malebranche un poco in cesso, 101 sì ch’ei non teman de le lor vendette; 102 e io, seggendo in questo loco stesso,
103 per un ch’io son, ne farò venir sette 104 quand’ io suffolerò, com’ è nostro uso 105 di fare allor che fori alcun si mette».
query.result:
**English:**
97 «If you want to see or hear», 98 the frightened one began again, 99 «Tuscans or Lombards, I will make some come;
100 but let the Malebranche stand back a little, 101 so that they do not fear their vengeance; 102 and I, sitting in this same place,
103 for one that I am, I will make seven come 104 when I whistle, as is our custom 105 to do when someone puts himself forward».
**Cornish:**
97 «Ma'th eus a vynna gweles po dhe klev», 98 an onan a veu boes a dhallathas, 99 Tuskan po Lombard, vy a wra henna dheus;
100 mes gadho an Malebranche dhe sevel y'n fordh byghan, 101 dhe vo na vo aga boes dhe aga venjans; 102 ha vy, ow sevel y'n an le mayn,
103 rag unn vy, vy a wra seith dheus 104 pyw hedho vy a suffla, kepar ha'n defnydh 105 dhe wul pan wruthyl onan dhe'y hun».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Cagnazzo a cotal motto levò ’l muso, 107 crollando ’l capo, e disse: «Odi malizia 108 ch’elli ha pensata per gittarsi giuso!».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Cagnazzo raised his snout at such a speech, 107 shaking his head, and said: «Listen to the malice 108 that he has thought of in order to throw himself down!».
**Cornish:**
106 Cagnazzo a dhallathas kepar henna a dhurna y fenowgh, 107 ow kryjya y ben, ha leverel: «Klev an drok 108 ev a wra pomys dhe omdhregh dhe'n fordh!».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Ond’ ei, ch’avea lacciuoli a gran divizia, 110 rispuose: «Malizioso son io troppo, 111 quand’ io procuro a’ mia maggior trestizia».
query.result:
**English:**
109 Whereupon he, who had snares in great abundance, 110 replied: «I am too malicious, 111 when I seek my greater sorrow».
**Cornish:**
109 Mes ev, hag o dheuth lachow y'n brassa rann, 110 a leverel: «Vy yw drok vy dhe brassa, 111 pyw hedho vy a wra dhe vy anken vy».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Alichin non si tenne e, di rintoppo 113 a li altri, disse a lui: «Se tu ti cali, 114 io non ti verrò dietro di gualoppo,
115 ma batterò sovra la pece l’ali.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Alichino could not hold himself back and, 113 interrupting the others, said to him: «If you fall, 114 I will not come galloping after you,
115 but I will beat my wings over the pitch.
**Cornish:**
112 Alichin ny alla y'n fordh ha, ow torri, 113 dhe'n erel erel, a leverel dhodho: «Ma'th eus a wra omdhregh, 114 vy ny wra dhe'th wortogal,
115 mes vy a wra'm skebba vy eskel war an pek».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
116 Lascisi ’l collo, e sia la ripa scudo, 117 a veder se tu sol più di noi vali».
118 O tu che leggi, udirai nuovo ludo: 119 ciascun da l’altra costa li occhi volse, 120 quel prima, ch’a ciò fare era più crudo.
query.result:
**English:**
116 He dropped his neck, and let the bank be his shield, 117 to see if you alone are worth more than us."
118 O you who read, you will hear of a new game: 119 each one turned his eyes away from the other bank, 120 he first, who was more savage in doing so.
**Cornish:**
116 Ev a omghellas y’i golon, hag an glann a vo y’i skoed, 117 rag weles orth pub onan moy es te a-werth.
118 O ty owth a wra, ty a glewsi a-dro nowyth: 119 pubonan a droas y’i lagadow a-bell an glann aral, 120 an kynsa, neb oas moy gwyls yn gweles hemma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Lo Navarrese ben suo tempo colse; 122 fermò le piante a terra, e in un punto 123 saltò e dal proposto lor si sciolse.
query.result:
**English:**
121 The Navarrese seized his moment well; 122 he planted his feet on the ground, and in an instant 123 he leapt and freed himself from their plan.
**Cornish:**
121 An Navarres a asas y'n eur yn ta; 122 ev a wrug y'n treys war an nor, ha'n termyn byghan 123 ev a lammas ha'gas y'n kensa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Di che ciascun di colpa fu compunto, 125 ma quei più che cagion fu del difetto; 126 però si mosse e gridò: «Tu se’ giunto!».
query.result:
**English:**
124 At which each one was pricked with remorse, 125 but most of all he who was the cause of the error; 126 therefore he moved and cried out: "You have arrived!".
**Cornish:**
124 Rag o onan o nessa culpa, 125 mes an hini a veu an achos a'n feth, 126 rag o a gavas ha'gas ha leveris: "Te'th pys!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Ma poco i valse: ché l’ali al sospetto 128 non potero avanzar; quelli andò sotto, 129 e quei drizzò volando suso il petto:
130 non altrimenti l’anitra di botto, 131 quando ’l falcon s’appressa, giù s’attuffa, 132 ed ei ritorna sù crucciato e rotto.
query.result:
**English:**
127 But it availed him little: for the wings of suspicion 128 could not outstrip him; he went down, 129 and the other, flying, raised his chest:
130 not otherwise the duck, from the bottom, 131 when the falcon approaches, dives down, 132 and he returns above, vexed and defeated.
**Cornish:**
127 Mes nyns o talvot dhemedhans: rag esel 128 nyns o gallosek drehedhes; ena a eas 129 ha'gas ena erel a vagas y'n dhor.
130 Yn par dhemedhans an elergh, 131 pan vynn an golvan ogas, a wragh war-nans, 132 ha'gas ena a dhehwel war-nans, fethys ha colsys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Ma l’altro fu bene sparvier grifagno 140 ad artigliar ben lui, e amendue 141 cadder nel mezzo del bogliente stagno.
query.result:
**English:**
139 But the other was indeed a fierce sparrowhawk 140 at seizing him well, and both of them 141 fell into the middle of the boiling lake.
**Cornish:**
139 Mes an hini aral veu yn sperver gryf 140 rag gryfya ytho yn ta, ha'gas an dhew 141 a gwythas y'n kres a'n lyn boghes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Lo caldo sghermitor sùbito fue; 143 ma però di levarsi era neente, 144 sì avieno inviscate l’ali sue.
query.result:
**English:**
142 The hot seizer was suddenly up; 143 but he was unable to rise, 144 so gummed were his wings.
**Cornish:**
142 An gwryssiour tomm a veu war-nans yn subet; 143 mes rag hyn, nyns o gallos dhemedhes, 144 kemmys o veu y'n esel y'n eselyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Barbariccia, con li altri suoi dolente, 146 quattro ne fé volar da l’altra costa 147 con tutt’ i raffi, e assai prestamente
148 di qua, di là discesero a la posta; 149 porser li uncini verso li ’mpaniati, 150 ch’eran già cotti dentro da la crosta.
query.result:
**English:**
145 Barbariccia, grieving with his other companions, 146 made four of them fly from the other bank 147 with all their grappling hooks, and very quickly
148 they descended from here and there to their posts; 149 they thrust their hooks towards the ensnared ones, 150 who were already cooked inside their crust.
**Cornish:**
145 Barbariccia, yn dolurys gans y'n gonhedhoryon aral, 146 a wrug peder a hedhas a'n aral cost 147 gans oll an raffys, ha yn fethys prest
148 a dhiskynnas a-dhyworth ha a-dhyworth dhemedhes dhe'n post; 149 ytho a wrug porsya an uncynis war-tu an reys, 150 o veu coghys a-ves y'n crosta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 E noi lasciammo lor così ’mpacciati.
query.result:
**English:**
151 And we left them thus entangled.
**Cornish:**
151 Ha nynj a'y lehas an reys yn par reys.
